title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 December 2012 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
00:06 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:24 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:24 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
00:28 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:33 <vmassol> has quit  
00:52 <jvdrean1> has quit  
01:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:35 <vmassol> has quit  
01:40 <jvelo> has quit  
01:45 <vanaltj> has joined #xwiki  
01:48 <vanaltj> hi, I'm trying to download xwiki war from website.  The download doesn't start, and the direct link gives 403 error.  anyone around who can help with that?  
01:49 <sdumitriu> Hi vanaltj  
01:49 <sdumitriu> Let me check  
01:49 <vanaltj> thanks!  
01:51 <sdumitriu> Looks like the OW2 server is in a bad state  
01:51 <sdumitriu> vanaltj: Use this one: http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-web/4.3/xwiki-enterprise-web-4.3.war  
01:52 <vanaltj> sdumitriu: thanks a lot for the alternate link :)  
01:52 <sdumitriu> You're welcome  
01:56 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
02:01 <sdumitriu> vanaltj: Will you need the XAR as well?  
02:01 <sdumitriu> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/4.3/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-4.3.xar  
02:03 <vanaltj> ah, I wasn't planning on it (but I'm also new to this, so maybe I misunderstand something?)  
02:04 <sdumitriu> Well, the .war will just give you the platform, you'll need the default wiki contents, which is the .xar  
02:04 <vanaltj> I guess I should read some docs and see what are the default set of pages it gives, maybe it is useful for my case.  
02:05 <sdumitriu> Or wait, actually 4.3 has the distribution wizard, which will fetch the right XAR for you  
02:06 <sdumitriu> (it's strange when new things happen and I'm left behind...)  
02:07 <vanaltj> haha, a big enough project and it gets hard for one person to stay on top of all new features...  
04:16 <tekzilla> has quit  
04:18 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki

04:39 <vmassol> has quit

07:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:46 <vmassol> has quit  
08:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <vmassol> has quit  
09:11 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <tdelafoss> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <vmassol> good morning  
09:48 <vmassol> wdyt about removing all info boxes related to XWiki 1.x?  
09:48 <vmassol> for example on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement  
09:48 <vmassol> even for XWiki 2.x  
09:49 <vmassol> we could keep XWiki 3.x and 4.x for now  
09:49 <vmassol> I'll send an email  
09:50 <tmortagne> big +1 for 1.x, 2.7.x seems to still be used so not sure for 2.x  
09:50 <vmassol> mail sent  
09:50 <vmassol> normally  
09:50 <vmassol> the wiki is supposed to match the last 2 versions only  
09:50 <vmassol> stable and dev  
09:51 <vmassol> so we're doing extra compared to our strategy already  
09:51 <vmassol> but OTOH we don't offer any archive  
09:52 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
10:16 <vmassol> have you been able to set up xvfb on jenkins in the end?  
10:16 <vmassol> (jenkins and on the agents)  
10:17 <mflorea> vmassol: good morninng, the plugin is installed but I need xvfb installed on all agents  
10:17 <mflorea> (or at least some, to try)  
10:17 <vmassol> have you installed it or asked the infra team?  
10:17 <mflorea> I'm opened an issue  
10:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:00 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <vmassol> guys do we agree that ATM the minimum resolution we support is 1280x1024?  
11:08 <vmassol> trying to find the emails and doc about this  
11:08 <vmassol> it's not listed on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HPrerequisites  
11:12 <vmassol> sburjan: what's the minimal resolution we support and that you're testing with?  
11:12 <sburjan> I tested a lot of time on 1208x1024  
11:13 <sburjan> now I am testing at full HD 1900x1080  
11:17 <tmortagne1> has quit  
11:21 <sburjan> has quit  
11:22 <Slashman> has quit  
11:26 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <jvdrean> The best thing about it is that the next logical step (4.4) would be to expose the panel "scope" in the Panels.PanelClass (hardcoded right now for the inclusion in 4.3.1), allowing panel writers to make their panels available (or not) in the other wikis  
11:46 <jvdrean> vmassol: the bug I had with the rendering of xwiki/1.0 panels was due to my local distrib  
11:46 <vmassol> ahah :) glad you you researched it more!  
11:54 <huhongbo> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <huhongbo> where can i get the xwiki now, seems the download site is error  
12:01 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:01 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <vmassol> http://download.forge.objectweb.org/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise-installer-generic-4.3-standard.jar  
12:05 <huhongbo> has xwiki any mirror site ? i'm waiting the ow2 site to back online  
12:06 <vmassol> huhongbo: you can use http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/ for now  
12:10 <huhongbo> use pom file to compile it?  
12:10 <vmassol> huhongbo: no  
12:10 <vmassol> just download the distribution  
12:10 <vmassol> which one do you need?  
12:11 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/  
12:11 <huhongbo> thanks, i got it  
12:12 <huhongbo> today ,i delete the war file then the xwiki folder is gone,is possible to restore the xwiki?mysql db is ok  
12:13 <vmassol> you just need to download the war file and set up the configuration again  
12:13 <vmassol> after that it depends where you had put your permanent directory  
12:15 <huhongbo> i have no attachment just wiki and some custom application,is all this in mysql db?  
12:18 <vmassol> yes  
12:18 <vmassol> huhongbo: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup  
12:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <mflorea> has quit  
13:11 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

14:13 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki

14:15 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <huhongbo> has quit  
14:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <Slashman> has quit  
14:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <jvelo> has quit  
15:15 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:15 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
15:30 <Slashman> has quit  
15:39 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <sburjan> vmassol, tmortagne : I commented on the rendering issue I've reported  
15:45 <vmassol> sburjan: can you reduce even more?  
15:45 <vmassol> "If I continue removing, content will be shown, but title will still fail."  
15:45 <vmassol> so that's good you should continue to remove  
15:45 <vmassol> whys top?  
15:45 <sburjan> because if I continue removing, content will display, but other vm files will continue crashing  
15:45 <vmassol> and?  
15:46 <vmassol> (I don't understand)  
15:46 <sburjan> isn't the purpose of this to see if failing ? If I remove more from it, it will slowly start to work and be ok  
15:46 <sburjan> \*to see it  
15:46 <vmassol> for me when you use the word "crashing" it means failing  
15:46 <vmassol> isn't it?  
15:46 <vmassol> do you mean there are 2 issues?  
15:47 <sburjan> attaching screenshot of failing stuff. give me 5 minutes  
15:47 <vmassol> one about the title computation and one about the full page rendering?  
15:47 <sburjan> yes  
15:47 <sburjan> and one for comments section  
15:47 <vmassol> ok anyway I guess we can take it from there, thanks  
15:56 <sburjan> vmassol: updated the issue with more details. hope it helps.  
15:58 <vmassol> sburjan: thanks  
15:59 <vmassol> sburjan: re the last screenshot  
15:59 <vmassol> would be good to click on the link and paste the content  
15:59 <vmassol> (in the issue)  
16:02 <sburjan> vmassol: done. I have attached it in a file, it's very large  
16:04 <sburjan`> has quit  
16:16 <vmassol> sdumitriu:  should have been you documenting this… :)  
16:32 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Right  
16:33 <vmassol> sdumitriu: feel free to update what I've documented, I quickly looked at plain.vm  
16:36 <sdumitriu> vmassol: I wonder if "exported form" is the best term  
16:36 <sdumitriu> Why not "rendered content"?  
16:37 <sdumitriu> Ah, nevermind  
16:37 <sdumitriu> I was cross-looking two lines, the "exported" was for xml  
16:39 <sdumitriu> vmassol: The OW2 forge server hosting our downloads has been down last night, several users couldn't download it  
16:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes we know  
16:39 <vmassol> it's ok now  
16:39 <sdumitriu> Should we add an "alternative" link?  
16:39 <vmassol> I think it's fine  
16:39 <vmassol> we don't want people to use our maven repo toom uch  
16:39 <vmassol> main reason being that we loose stats :)  
16:39 <vmassol> (other reason is bandwidth)  
16:40 <vmassol> (makes our builds and XE slower)  
16:40 <vmassol> yes but better not advertise it  
16:40 <vmassol> except when there's a downtime maybe but we should remove it afterwards  
16:40 <vmassol> anyway it's fixed now  
16:40 <sdumitriu> Or, since we're using JS on the download page, we could detect this automatically and redirect to our server  
16:41 <vmassol> I don't think it's a big deal honestly, I'm not sure that we should "over-engineer" it  
16:41 <vmassol> it doesn't happen that often  
16:57 <msmeria> has quit  
16:57 <sburjan> vmassol: I have another file which when imported, it will lock down the Wiki for more than 10 minutes, and the fail with an OOM. Should I report this also ? Ludovic told me that xwiki should not fail with these files. And if fails with OOM, to check if it recovers by itself without restart. The wiki recovers after the OOM happens, but for 10 minutes while tries to import, it is completely dead. Should I report this ?  
17:02 <vmassol> sburjan: you can report it, there's no reason it should lock the wiki and I don't see why it does. We're using a servlet container which is multi hreaded  
17:02 <vmassol> it should only lock 1 thread  
17:02 <vmassol> ofc it can make the wiki slow but we can't do anything about this  
17:03 <vmassol> maybe your machine is underpowered?  
17:03 <sburjan> xwiki deployed in Tomcat with  -server -Xms512m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=192m  
17:04 <vmassol> it's not memory  
17:04 <vmassol> it's CPU  
17:04 <sburjan> well OOM is about memory, right ?  
17:04 <vmassol> well it's both  
17:04 <vmassol> :)  
17:04 <sburjan> :)  
17:04 <vmassol> I had missed the OOM part in your message  
17:04 <vmassol> nothing we can do about tht  
17:05 <vmassol> it just means your server has not enough memory  
17:06 <sburjan> http://pastebin.com/r6c0mFbt CPU specs  
17:06 <sburjan> ok. I'll try with 1.2 GB. if it still fails with 1.2 GB, something is odd. It's a big excel file ~2000 entries. but shouldn't use that much RAM  
17:07 <sburjan> 2600 entries actually  
17:07 <sburjan> I can almost hear GC screaming and losing against xwiki  
17:08 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <vmassol> you need to find if it's xwiki or libreoffice taking the time  
17:09 <vmassol> and the memory  
17:10 <jvelo> tmortagne: Hi. I've noticed that sometimes on a 4.3 I get redirected to XWiki.Distribution  
17:10 <jvelo> Any idea what causes that ?  
17:10 <jvelo> (note it's not a raw XE, it  
17:10 <jvelo> (it's a project on top of XE)  
17:11 <tmortagne> jvelo: you mean XWiki.Distribution page in view mode or you get the distribution wizard ?  
17:11 <jvelo> XWiki.Distribution in view mode  
17:11 <jvelo> I get redirected there at odd moments  
17:11 <jvelo> like when viewing regular pages  
17:12 <tmortagne> I have no idea, XWiki.Distribution is what is set when redirecting to distribution action but I dont know why you would get view action  
17:12 <jvelo> OK  
17:12 <jvelo> anything that could trigger the distribution action ?  
17:12 <tmortagne> well yes if you are not up to date :)  
17:13 <tmortagne> normaly to get distribution wizard you need:  
17:13 <tmortagne> \* no distribution or partial distribution status  
17:14 <tmortagne> \* invalid extensions or the UI associated to the current distribution not installed  
17:14 <sburjan> vmassol: yes, but this is advanced debugging and I don't know how to do it.  
17:14 <vmassol> sburjan: export with libreoffice  
17:15 <vmassol> and see how long it takes  
17:15 <vmassol> easy!  
17:15 <tmortagne> jvelo: you should have a log about distribution status at the beginning of the log  
17:15 <jvelo> Ok that might be it  
17:15 <sburjan> export what ? the page containing the bad document is empty  
17:15 <jvelo> I have a NPE at startup regarding distribution status  
17:15 <jvelo> I'll look into that  
17:15 <sburjan> I wait 10 minutes to get an empty page  
17:16 <tmortagne> jvelo: I fixed one recently reported by jvdrean  
17:16 <tmortagne> what version are you working on ?  
17:16 <jvelo> 4.2  
17:23 <tmortagne> can't find the jira issue but I would bet for the default UI not indicated in your distribution/war pom.xml  
17:23 <tmortagne> which used to produce a nullpointer  
17:23 <tmortagne> when you also have the id of your distribution in your manifest  
17:25 <sburjan> has quit  
17:28 <jvelo> tmortagne: OK thanks I'll check this out  
17:29 <tmortagne> jvelo: not sure it's fixed actually, could you give me your stack trace ?  
17:36 <jvelo> tmortagne: http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=pYgpt7SJ  
17:48 <tmortagne> jvelo: yes that's it, missing UI in the pom.xml  
18:24 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
18:57 <mflorea> has quit  
19:00 <vmassol> guys I think we should drop the shading we do in rendering standalone  
19:01 <vmassol> it's far from perfect and we're not shading a lot of libs  
19:01 <vmassol> to cite a few: com.steadystate.css, javax.validation, ant, aspectj, slf4j, etc  
19:01 <vmassol> and that's not including libs we cannot shade  
19:02 <vmassol> javax.xml  
19:02 <vmassol>                    - org.w3c  
19:02 <vmassol>                    - org.apache.xerces  
19:02 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:03 <vmassol> so I think we could keep a standalone jar to make it easy for people to try out xwiki rendering but that should not be used for production  
19:03 <vmassol> I'll send a mail  
19:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt?  
19:08 <vmassol> (before I send the mail)  
19:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: I tend to think that we should probably remove rendering standalone  
19:09 <vmassol> it's nice for demos  
19:09 <vmassol> ie for testdriving rendering  
19:09 <vmassol> quickly  
19:09 <vmassol> when you don't use maven  
19:09 <vmassol> it's easy for us to generate a jar with everything  
19:09 <vmassol> using the assembly plugin  
19:10 <vmassol> ok sending the email you can reply there  
19:10 <tmortagne> but that would be an unusable jar in any real use case  
19:10 <vmassol> yes it's not for production  
19:10 <vmassol> and in any case I wouldn't recommend the current shaded jar for prod either  
19:10 <tmortagne> I don't say th current one is good :)  
19:11 <vmassol> well  
19:11 <vmassol> our doc says that it's good  
19:11 <vmassol> this is what I want to change  
19:12 <vmassol> to have an assembly but to exlpicitly say it's not to be used for real just to test driveif you don't use maven  
19:12 <tmortagne> everything is failing on jenkins  
19:12 <vmassol> now if we all agreee we could drop it but I'm not entirely sure yet  
19:12 <tmortagne> some general network issue it seems  
19:12 <vmassol> got to go  
19:12 <vmassol> but bb in 1 hour  
19:12 <vmassol> btw ATM there's a problem with standalone which has dup components  
19:15 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki
